investments

Class MutualFund

  • java.lang.Object
    • investments.MutualFund
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MutualFund
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class for a mutual fund object.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<User,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double>> investors
      A hash map of users that have invested into this fund as keys and an array list of doubles in the following format: {amount user invested, percentage of the fund the user owns through this investment}
      private java.lang.String name
      The name of the mutual fund
      private int risk
      The risk level of the mutual fund: 1 is low risk, 2 is medium risk and 3 is a high risk fund
      private java.util.ArrayList<Stock> stocks
      The stocks in that are in this mutual fund

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to restore the mutual fund's information after the ATM is restarted.
        Parameters:
        ois - instance of the ObjectInputStream class used to read the account object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object could not be found
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
